title: Bayern Munich 1-2 Hoffenheim: Niko Kovac's side slip from the top of the Bundesliga
text:
Bayern Munich have slipped from the top of the Bundesliga after suffering a shock home defeat to Hoffenheim.

Hoffenheim shocked the hosts after Sargis Adamyan opened the scoring on the 54th minute after the visitors capitalised on Corentin Tolisso losing possession of the ball in his own third.

Bayern Munich levelled with 15 mins remaining after Robert Lewandowski leaped highest to bury a header home. Adamyan put Hoffenheim back in front after a fine turn and finish put the ball beyond Manuel Neuer and handed the visitors all three points.

More to follow.

A Sargis Adamyan double condemned Bayern Munich to a home defeat in the Bundesliga

Robert Lewandowski had levelled late on in the second half before letting their lead slip

A Robert Lewandowski header got Bayern back into the game as they searched for a winner

Niko Kovac was unable to inspire his side to victory as Bayern fell from the top of the league

MATCH FACTS Bayern Munich (4-2-3-1) : Neuer; Pavard, Boateng, Sule, Kimmich; Alcantara, Tolisso (Perisic 60); Coman (Muller 60), Coutinho, Gnabry; Lewandowski Subs not used: Cuisance, Davies, Mai, Martinez, Ulreich Booked: Alcantara Goals: Lewandowski (73) Manager: Niko Kovac Hoffenheim (3-5-2): Baumann; Posch, Akpoguma, Hubner; Kaderabek (Stafylidis 62), Rudy, Grillitsch (Nordtveit 67), Geiger, Skov; Bebou, Adamyan (Bicakcic 82) Subs not used: Baumgartner, Brenet, Locadia, Pentke, Riberio, Rupp Booked: Goals: Adamyan (54, 79) Manager: Alfred Schreuder Stadium: Allianz Arena

Sargis Adamyan put Hoffenheim ahead after the away side capitalised on a Tolisso error

The goal came as a shock to the German champions after their 7-2 rout over Spurs in midweek

Adamyan almost opened the scoring for Hoffenheim but Jerome Boateng recovered to block
